meanings.definition: A type of slow-growing cancer that usually starts in the lining of the digestive tract or lungs.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the carcinoids in her lungs were growing slowly.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied the carcinoids found in the digestive tract.
meanings.sent3: The carcinoids in the digestive tract decided to take things slow and not spread too quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening was like the carcinoids, quietly growing beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The image of the carcinoids creeping along the digestive tract stayed with him.

meanings.definition: Tumors that release hormones into the bloodstream.
meanings.sent1: The endocrinologist specialized in treating patients with carcinoids that released hormones.
meanings.sent2: The carcinoids in her body were causing hormonal imbalances.
meanings.sent3: The carcinoids at the hormone party were the life of the bloodstream.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like carcinoids, spreading their influence throughout his body.
meanings.sent5: The idea of carcinoids releasing hormones painted a vivid picture in her mind.
